I make butter in a shaker bottle. (Just take out the metal blender.)
-Room temp heavy cream (leave on counter for about 4 hours)
-shaker bottle (minus the wire ball)
-salt

Shake vigorously for about 5 min. I didn’t have to strain in cheese cloth or do the ice water trick.

Pour out the buttermilk, salt to taste. Refrigerate and use within 3 weeks. 😋

Part of the trouble may have been not using true heavy cream -- the only ingredient should be cream. Carrageenen is a seaweed extract that acts as a thickener/gelling agent -- it's used in the "heavy cream" in the video to provide a thickness and mouth feel more like true heavy cream.

Unfortunately carrageenen is being used in more and more dairy products as a cheap extender; you'll also see products like guar gum being used for the same purpose as well.
